pullRequest.body:
Prove a bunch of results about `stabilizer G s` where `Group G`, `MulAction G α`, `s : Set α`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7303452405/job/19903984667)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7303452405/job/19903984429)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7303452405/job/19903984810)
I imagine rewriting by `mem_stabilizer_iff` before the case split avoids having to rewrite twice.
Does this generalize to two different groups?
Can you add the `MulOpposite` version too? Or is there a more general statement that works over two types?

There are two `MulOpposite` statements actually, which makes the situation even more irritating given that I can't seem to generalise the statement to two groups. `stabilizer G _ : Subgroup G`, so the only option would be to generalise with a map on one side, but then I need that map to be injective and equivariant or something like that. I certainly can't get much more general than action of a subgroup on a group.
Can you add some subheadings for `Set` and `Finset`?

Sure. Btw I really dislike how I have to `MulAction.something_stabilizer_set`/`MulAction.something_stabilizer_finset`. I would much prefer being able to write `Set.something_mulStabilizer`/`Finset.something_addStabilizer`. Do you think it's worth a rename?
Yes, but with an `Injective (· • b : α → β)` assumption that's not covered by any typeclass.
I'd prefer to see this derived from the bundled spelling with `map` and `\bot`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Stabilizers of sets/finsets
